Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "feed2catalog should write page items in ascending chronological order" (#4757) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Low priority issue. Just helps looking through the catalog manually.

Today, the commits on a catalog page are in ascending chronological order with respect to the `commitTimeStamp`. This makes sense.

However items within a single page are in reverse chronological order. This happens to be consistent today because of an implementation detail of how `Dictionary<TKey, TValue>` implements `IEnumerable`.

Note that all jobs that read the catalog should sort items using the `commitTimeStamp` and should not depend on item ordering.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "Filter out unavailable packages in curated feed controller" (#4755) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: Fix https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/issues/4750. Depends on https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/pull/4677.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Incorrect messaging while confirming a co-ownership request" (#4754) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Steps:
1. Accept a co-ownership request by clicking the mail you get when somebody adds you as a co-owner of a package

**Expected:** The message should say: "Ownership Confirmed". 

**Actual:** It says "Email confirmed"
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14800916/30883748-0b9c222e-a2c2-11e7-84ff-7a70e3300946.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Content Service Caching isn't being used" (#4753) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
The contentService that is used by the PagesController (https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/master/src/NuGetGallery/Controllers/PagesController.cs) doesn't appear to being persisted.

Every time the PagesController is called, a new contentService instance is given to it. This means that the old instance with the cached content is actually not used. This leads to us always retrieving the content from blob storage and never hitting the cache.

I believe this is due to the fact that we don't register the content service as a single instance with the DI container (not sure i'm using the right terminology here). I think adding a reference to the content service indicating that it should be single instance in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGetGallery/blob/master/src/NuGetGallery/App_Start/DefaultDependenciesModule.cs should fix this issue (it did for me locally).

Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "Fix "OwnerRequests.cshtml could not be found"" (#4752) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody: This was a file I used to have but got rid of. Not sure why VS and local build doesn't fail/alert on this, but it fails on the build machines.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "ReadMe input persists on cancelling an upload" (#4751) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Repro steps:

1. Start uploading a package on Upload page
2. Cancel the upload

**Expected**: The page gets reset to its original

**Actual**: The ReadMe input persists:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/14800916/30876787-7a520cb2-a2ac-11e7-88d9-1ecae057bd9d.png)

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Curated feeds don't filter out deleted packages" (#4750) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
It is unclear whether there is user impact since package deletes are rare and curated feeds don't have many packages.

The code should still filter out deleted.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Get error MSB4057: The target "_IsProjectRestoreSupported" does not exist in the project." when using nuget.exe v4.3.0 to restore the package for the WiX Toolset project" (#5940) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

if I update nuget.exe to v4.3.0, then I use this nuget.exe to restore the package for the WiX Toolset project(not reference other project), I would get the error "error MSB4057: The target "_IsProjectRestoreSupported" does not exist in the project." Is that expected? I can restore it successfully on the NuGet v4.1.0.

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe):
NuGet.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx):
v4.3.0

VS version (if appropriate):
VS2017 15.3.5

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)):
Win 10

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
Yes, v4.1.0
## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create a Setup Project for WiX v3.

2.Use nuget.exe 4.3.0 restore package for this project, the command line is:

nuget.exe restore "C:\Users\Admin\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\SetupProject1\SetupProject1.sln" -ConfigFile "C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Roaming\NuGet\NuGet.Config" -NoCache -NonInteractive -Verbosity detailed

### Verbose Logs
C:\Users\Admin\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\SetupProject1\SetupProject1\SetupProject1.wixproj : error MSB4057: The target "_IsProjectRestoreSupported" does not exist in the project.
C:\Users\Admin\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\SetupProject1\SetupProject1\SetupProject1.wixproj : warning NU1503: Skipping restore for project 'C:\Users\Admin\Documents\Visual Studio 2017\Projects\SetupProject1\SetupProject1\SetupProject1.wixproj'. The project file may be invalid or missing targets required for restore. [C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\qbcbt5xq.jzs.nugetinputs.targets]
C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\gtzkott2.4zo.nugetrestore.targets(131,5): warning : Unable to find a project to restore! [C:\Users\Admin\AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\qbcbt5xq.jzs.nugetinputs.targets]

Please include verbose logs (NuGet.exe <COMMAND> -verbosity detailed | dotnet.exe <COMMAND> --verbosity diag | etc...)

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Projects with multiple TFM throws exception on restore in Visual Studio 15.3.4" (#5927) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

When building in Visual studio the error shown under verbose logs are dumped in output, and no packages are updated. It looks similar to #5645 and I commented on this with the reply to create a new issue.

NuGet product used: Visual Studio 

NuGet version: 4.3.0 (as stated in About Visual Studio)

dotnet version: 2.0.0

VS version: 15.3.4

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): Win10 v1703 (15063.608)

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version:
I am not sure, discovered this now.

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. Create an empty solution

2. Create an empty project, remove any files

3. Edit the .csproj file to look like this:

```
<Project Sdk="Microsoft.NET.Sdk" ToolsVersion="15.0">
  <PropertyGroup>
    <TargetFrameworks>netstandard1.6;net461</TargetFrameworks>
  </PropertyGroup>

  <PropertyGroup Condition="'$(Configuration)|$(TargetFramework)|$(Platform)'=='Debug|netstandard1.6|AnyCPU'">
    <TreatWarningsAsErrors>true</TreatWarningsAsErrors>
    <WarningsAsErrors />
    <WarningLevel>4</WarningLevel>
  </PropertyGroup>


</Project>

```

4. Try to rebuild

An exception that is shown below under Verbose logs is dumped in output on detailed build verbosity

## Other suggested things

Here is the strange thing. If I try to run dotnet restore on the solution in command prompt, the error disappears in Visual Studio when rebuilding (doesn't apply to all projects).

### Verbose Logs
```
Error occurred while restoring NuGet packages: System.InvalidOperationException: The operation failed as details for project Project1 could not be loaded.
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.VisualStudio.NetCorePackageReferenceProject.GetPackageSpecsAsync(DependencyGraphCacheContext context)
   at NuGet.PackageManagement.DependencyGraphRestoreUtility.<GetSolutionRestoreSpec>d__6.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.SolutionRestoreManager.SolutionRestoreJob.<RestorePackageSpecProjectsAsync>d__18.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ValidateEnd(Task task)
   at NuGet.SolutionRestoreManager.SolutionRestoreJob.<RestoreAsync>d__16.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.ExceptionServices.ExceptionDispatchInfo.Throw()
   at NuGet.SolutionRestoreManager.SolutionRestoreJob.<RestoreAsync>d__16.MoveNext()
--- End of stack trace from previous location where exception was thrown ---
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.ThrowForNonSuccess(Task task)
   at System.Runtime.CompilerServices.TaskAwaiter.HandleNonSuccessAndDebuggerNotification(Task task)
   at NuGet.SolutionRestoreManager.SolutionRestoreJob.<ExecuteAsync>d__15.MoveNext()

```
### Sample Project

[MultipleTFM.zip](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/1326614/MultipleTFM.zip)

Events.RelatedDescription: Reopened issue "nuget.exe v4.4.0-preview3 expects nuget.config although .config is specified at solution level" (#5933) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem
Updating to a newer version on NuGet.exe breaks building solution. Errors show that it is looking for nuget.config in project folders when there already is a nuget.config at the solution level. 

Targets _IsProjectRestoreSupported and _GenerateRestoreProjectPathWalk seem to be needed. 

Command: NuGet.exe restore -ConfigFile src\.nuget\nuget.config -PackagesDirectory packages\ src\Project.sln

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): NuGet.exe and VS UI

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 4.5.0.4487

VS version (if appropriate): 15.4.0 Preview 3.0 [26919.1.d15rel]

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10 v15063 (10.0.15063) 

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: 3.4.4.1321

## Other suggested things

### Verbose Logs
error MSB4057: The target "_GenerateRestoreProjectPathWalk" does not exist in the project.
error MSB4057: The target "_IsProjectRestoreSupported" does not exist in the project.
AppData\Local\Temp\NuGetScratch\bpguxuqr.e1t.nugetrestore.targets(476,5): error : File \InnerProject1\src\.nuget\nuget.config' does not exist.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add XML documentation for NuGet libraries" (#2537) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: NuGet.Core.sln projects have warnings suppressed for XML doc problems. If possible these should be cleaned up and the noWarn sections in project.json removed.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add verbosity option to dotnet restore3" (#3772) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Currently dotnet restore3 does not have a verbosity option, it must be passed with `/p:verbosity` directly to MSBuild.

There are currently three sets of log levels:
1. NuGet log levels
2. CLI log levels
3. MSBuild log levels

The restore command should be made to match the rest of the CLI commands.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Lock projects during restore with CPS IProjectLockService" (#3807) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody: CPS Projects should be locked during restore so that consumers of restore outputs can wait until the result is complete.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add a public target to NuGet.targets that can be referenced using BeforeTargets" (#4634) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
The public *Restore* target is called on the solution metaproj when restoring a solution. Within each project the top level target called is *_GenerateRestoreProjectSpec*

To allow users to perform tasks before and after restore NuGet.targets should add a public target that can be used with BeforeTargets and AfterTargets

The fix for this could be as simple as renaming *_GenerateRestoreProjectSpec* and adding a comment in NuGet.targets if we decide to stay with that target.

https://github.com/dotnet/cli/issues/5683

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Fix GetInstalledPackagesWithCustomRestorePackagesPath  & GetInstalledPackagesForProjectWithCustomRestorePackagesPath " (#5945) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
These 2 E2E have been failing since they were added. 
Added in https://github.com/NuGet/NuGet.Client/pull/1666

I did a short investigation and I think that there are 2 issues here.

1. Looks like a product bug, the metadata is not populated with any value whatsoever. 
2. There are no packages installed other than NetCoreApp in the netcore case, so even if it did populate it with a value there it would be from the Fallback Folder one (??) //cc @emgarten on this.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Fix flaky E2E tests and help clean up" (#5944) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
[Results.txt](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/files/1335110/Results.txt)


The above test file has the list of most common E2E test failures.

Help clean our CI and pick some of them, specially if you are the owner of any of them. If they are going to stay flaky, then consider adding a functional test instead and remove it from E2E.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Updates to the NuGet.org Terms of Use" (#8) at NuGet/Announcements
Events.RelatedBody:
Today, we’re updating the NuGet.org Terms of Use and Privacy Statement. As we [announced](https://blog.nuget.org/20170907/Changes-to-NuGet-dot-org-service-management-and-performance-improvements-in-China.html) two weeks ago, the NuGet.org service is now a part of Microsoft. The NuGet open source codebase (both the NuGet gallery and the NuGet client) will remain open source and continue as .NET Foundation supported projects under the same terms as before.

We encourage you to read the full [Terms of Use](https://www.nuget.org/policies/Terms) and [Privacy Statement](https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=521839), as well as the [blog post](https://blog.nuget.org/20170907/Changes-to-NuGet-dot-org-service-management-and-performance-improvements-in-China.html) about the changes. For your convenience, below is a quick summary.

There are no changes to the way you publish and consume packages from NuGet.org. The Terms of Use and Privacy Statement have been updated to reflect the change in ownership, as well as how Microsoft will process the data collected, and manage copyright and trademark infringement notices.

Our goal is to provide an agile and reliable global service, and we remain fully committed to ensuring a healthy and open ecosystem around NuGet. The .NET Foundation and Microsoft want NuGet to meet the evolving needs of our community. For questions about our policies, please contact us by email at [feedback@nuget.org](mailto:feedback@nuget.org?subject=Regarding%20updates%20to%20the%20NuGet.org%20Terms%20of%20Use).
